org.cloudifysource.esc.driver.provisioning.byon
Class ByonProvisioningDriver

java.lang.Object
  org.cloudifysource.esc.driver.provisioning.BaseProvisioningDriver
      org.cloudifysource.esc.driver.provisioning.byon.ByonProvisioningDriver
All Implemented Interfaces:
ProvisioningDriverClassContextAware, ProvisioningDriver
public class ByonProvisioningDriver
extends BaseProvisioningDriver
implements ProvisioningDriver, ProvisioningDriverClassContextAware

A bring-your-own-node (BYON) CloudifyProvisioning implementation. Parses a groovy file as a source of available machines to operate as cloud nodes, assuming the nodes are Linux machines with SSH installed. If GigaSpaces is not already installed on a node, this class will install GigaSpaces and run the agent.

Since:
2.0.1
Author:
noak

startMachine

public MachineDetails startMachine(String locationId,
                                   long timeout,
                                   TimeUnit timeUnit)
                            throws TimeoutException,
                                   CloudProvisioningException
Description copied from interface: ProvisioningDriver
Starts an additional machine on the cloud , on the specific location, to scale out this specific service. In case of an error while provisioning the machine, any allocated resources should be freed before throwing a CloudProvisioningException or TimeoutException to the caller.

Specified by:
startMachine in interface ProvisioningDriver
Parameters:
locationId - the location to allocate the machine to.
timeout - Time duration to wait for the instance.
timeUnit - Time unit to wait for the instance.
Returns:
The details of the started instance.
Throws:
TimeoutException - In case the instance was not started in the allotted time.
CloudProvisioningException - If a problem was encountered while starting the machine.

                                         throws TimeoutException,
                                                CloudProvisioningException
Description copied from interface: ProvisioningDriver
Start the management machines for this cluster. This method is called once by the cloud administrator when bootstrapping a new cluster.

Specified by:
startManagementMachines in interface ProvisioningDriver
Parameters:
duration - timeout duration.
unit - timeout unit.
Returns:
The created machine details.
Throws:
TimeoutException - If creating the new machines exceeded the given timeout.
CloudProvisioningException - If the machines needed for management could not be provisioned.

Description copied from interface: ProvisioningDriver
Called when the service that this provisioning implementation is responsible for scaling is undeployed. The implementation is expected to release/close all relevant resources, such as thread pools, sockets, files, etc.
